#summary property()
#labels api,1.0

*Category*:

[ModelInitializationFunctions Model Initialization Functions]

*Description*:

Use this method to map an object property in your application to a table column in your database. You only need to use this method when you want to override the mapping that Wheels performs (i.e. `user.firstName` mapping to `users.firstname` for example).

*Return Type*:

Void

*History*:

-

*Parameters*:

|| *Name* || *Type* || *Required* || *Default* || *Description* ||
|| *name* || string || true || - || Name of the property ||
|| *column* || string || true || - || Name of the column to map the property to ||

*Examples*:

{{{
<!--- in models/User.cfc --->
<cffunction name="init">
  <cfset property(name="firstName", column="STR_USERS_FNAME")>
</cffunction>
}}}
